snippet: The N.F.L. has the highest practice-to-games ratio of any professional sport, but full participation in a team’s practice hardly seems a prerequisite to a player playing, and playing well.
abstract: Practice is a staple of life in the NFL, but players and coaches agree that it is not a prerequisite to playing and playing well.
lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. has the highest practice-to-games ratio of any professional sport, but full participation in a team’s practice hardly seems a prerequisite to a player playing, and playing well.

headline.seo: How Do the Giants Get to the Super Bowl? Practice. Practice?
headline.main: In N.F.L., Practice Can Make Perfect, but Then So Can the Lack of It
headline.print_headline: In N.F.L., Practice Can Make Perfect, but Then So Can the Lack of It
